name: thousand/one; lie/truth
description:
thousand/one; lie/truth
by michael "gb_camera d.

a short and abstract game based on my own experiences with gender, mental health, and social interaction, as well as the sunglasses emoji and the concept of depression (that's a lot, but i tried my best! it comes off a little lighthearted and goofy, though.)

control the player with wasd — use space to change your self-perspective, which will reduce damage you take from enemies but increase passive damage per second. other interactions... you'll just have to play and find out for yourself. i'm not here to put words in your mouth (well, at least more than what's here.)

i would recommend you take your time with this game and play multiple times with different playstyles, but i can't stop you. regardless, thank you for playing!

full credits can be found here

made as project 3 for cdm 175 spring 2022 @ uc davis
